millsfield:images_texts:
EXTRACT FROM THE 70-PAGE REPORT ON A
FULL YEAR'S "METEOROLOGICAL SURVEY OF
PROPOSED SITES FOR THE SAN FRANCISCO
MUNICIPAL, AIRPORT."
1.
Weather observations started July 1,
1927, under the
direction of the San Francisco Office of
the United States
Weather Bureau.
Daily observations were taken over a period of
one year at each of
the sites located at Mills Field, South San
Francisco, San Mateo, and Beresford.
"Site No. 6 (Mills Field), the location of the present
temporary airport is therefore recommended as a result of the
me torological survey as the most suitable one for the permanent
location of the San Francisco Municipal Airport.
All factors
considered, no other suggested
site appears to have as
favorable meteorological conditions as this one.
"The present site of the San Francisco Municipal Airport
includes a small
portion of Site No. 4 (adjoining and
to the
south of Mills Field) and,
should it become advisable to extend
the boundaries of the present airport in a north-south đirection,
the survey shows that the extension should be to
the southward.
Meteorological conditions over Site No.2 (South San Prancisco)
Tomer de 11en, poorer vat dirt night a 710011s an
extension in that direction as they indicate more fog,
more turbulence
are found over the present site of the
airport and the area immediately south thereof."

properties.sfomuseum:description: Report titled “Extract from 70-page report on a full year’s ‘meteorological survey of proposed sites for the San Francisco Municipal Airport’”; subjects include weather observation and description of Site No. 6, location of temporary airport at Mills Field; single typewritten sheet.
properties.wof:name: report: City and County of San Francisco, meteorological survey of proposed airport sites
